briefdescription.para: [in] An array of characters that describe the lexeme.
[in] A pointer to the name of the file containing the lexeme.
[in] The line number from the source file that the lexeme occurred on.

simplesect.para: A pointer to a Lexeme structure with the desired properties.

parameterdescription.para: malloc was unable to allocate memory.

simplesect.para: fname is not copied because it would only one copy is stored for all Lexeme structures that share it.
lexeme points to a Lexeme structure created by createLexeme(char *, const char *, unsigned int).
The memory at lexeme and all of its elements will be freed.
We do not free (*lex)->fname because it is shared between many Lexeme structures and is free'd by whoever created them.
A pointer to a LexemeList structure with the desired properties.

parameterdescription.para: malloc was unable to allocate memory.

briefdescription.para: [in,out] A pointer to the LexemeList structure to add lex to.
[in] A pointer to the Lexeme structure to add to list.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a Lexeme structure to a LexemeList structure.

simplesect.para: lexeme was created by createLexeme(char *, const char *, unsigned int).
lexeme will be added on to the end of list and the size of list will be updated accordingly.
A pointer to the added Lexeme structure (will be the same as lexeme).

parameterdescription.para: realloc was unable to allocate memory.

briefdescription.para: [in,out] A pointer to the LexemeList structure to delete.

simplesect.para: list was created by createLexemeList(void) and contains items added by addLexeme(LexemeList *, Lexeme *).
The memory at list and any of its associated members will be freed.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *buffer, unsigned int size, const char *fname)
memberdef.name: scanBuffer

briefdescription.para: [in] An array of characters to tokenize.
[in] The number of characters in buffer.
[in] An array of characters representing the name of the file used to read buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Scans through a character buffer, removing unecessary characters and generating lexemes. Lexemes are separated by whitespace (but newline characters are kept as their own lexeme). String literals are handled a bit differently: starting at the first quotation character, characters are collected until either an unescaped quotation character is read (that is, a quotation character not preceeded by a colon which itself is not proceeded by a colon) or a newline or carriage return character is read, whichever comes first. This handles the odd case of strings such as "::" which print out a single colon. Also handled are the effects of commas, ellipses, and bangs (!).

simplesect.para: size is the number of characters starting at the memory location pointed to by buffer.
A pointer to a LexemeList structure.
